column2: 2017 年，段在自己出身城市獲選為香港中文大學的第八副校長與校長。

column1: He took up the post in January 2018. During the 2019 Hong Kong protests, he was condemned by CUHK students for failing to criticise police excesses but later won plaudits after an evening-long discussion with them in public and private.
column2: 他在 2018 年 1 月就職。在 2019 年香港民主化抗議中，他被中大學生譴責為未能批評警察濫權，但之後在徹夜與學生公開與閉門長談後獲得好評。

column1: Tuan's research group focuses on bioengineering and tissue regeneration as applied to the musculoskeletal system, with an interest in translational research.
column2: 段的研究團隊因對轉譯研究的興趣，專注於生物工程與組織再生，可應用於骨骼肌肉系統。

column1: Tuan's group has expertise in the study of adult stem cells and in the development of the musculoskeletal system.
column2: 段的研究團隊專精於成人幹細胞研究，以及對骨骼肌肉系統的發展。

column1: Among their efforts is a research project aimed at using 3D printing technology to restore function of joints damaged by diseases such as osteoarthritis, and work funded in 2016 to study model systems on the International Space Station.
column2: 其研究成果包括一項使用 3D 列印科技，以恢復因骨關節炎而失去的關節功能，2016 年獲得資金，用於國際太空站的模形系統研究。

column1: The airport was built in 1936 during Japanese rule with its origins as a Japanese military airbase, the Taihoku Airfield (Japanese: 臺北飛行場 Hepburn: Taihoku Hikōjō), also known as Matsuyama Airfield (松山飛行場).
column2: 本機場建於1936年的日本統治時期，原為日本空軍機場，當時稱為台北飛行場，又稱松山飛行場。

column1: After World War II, in 1946, it was taken over by the Republic of China Air Force.
column2: 二次世界大戰之後的1946年，由中華民國空軍取得。

column1: Before the end of the Chinese Civil War and the establishment of the People's Republic of China, the airport provided flight routes between Shanghai and Taipei, occasionally via Fuzhou.
column2: 在中國內戰結束、中華人民共和國政府成立之前，該機場提供台北上海航線，有時也飛往福州。

column1: Shared military and civilian use—both domestic and international—began on 16 April 1950 in the reconstructed Civil Aeronautics Administration Taipei Airport (交通部民用航空局台北航空站).
column2: 1950年4月16日起，改組的交通部民用航空局台北航空站，將該機場設為軍事與民航兩用， 包括國內與國際航線。

column1: Domestic destinations have been Kaohsiung, Hualien, Taichung, Penghu, and Tainan.
column2: 國內航線曾包括高雄、花蓮、台中、澎湖與台南航線。

column1: The first international destinations were Seattle, Tokyo, Pusan, Manila, Bangkok, and Hong Kong.
column2: 最初開始飛行的國際航線包括西雅圖、 東京、釜山、馬尼拉、曼谷、香港。

column1: The first international airlines included Northwest Airlines, Pan American Airlines, and Hong Kong Airways (now Cathay Pacific).
column2: 最初的國際航空公司包括西北航空、泛美航空、香港航空（現在的國泰航空）。

column1: Later, the airport became too small to handle an increased number of passengers, even after a series of expansions.
column2: 之後， 即使在歷經幾次擴建之後， 該機場還是太小而無法容納增加的旅客。

column1: This later worsened when new wide-body jets became common at the airport.
column2: 之後該機場的廣體客機增加， 情況更為惡化。

column1: Therefore, all international activities were relocated to Taoyuan International Airport (then known as Chiang Kai-shek International) after its inauguration on 26 February 1979.
column2: 因此，所有國際航班都轉移到於1979年2月26日啟用的桃園國際機場（當時稱做中正國際機場）。

column1: Consequently, the passenger load at the airport dropped from 6.2 million in 1978 to 2.9 million in 1979 (a 53% decrease).
At its peak in 1997, the airport handled over 15.3 million passengers annually.
column2: 1997年該機場的乘客人數達到高峰， 一年超過1,530萬人。

column1: Service to Taichung and Chiayi was stopped in mid-2007 after the load factor dropped significantly due to Taiwan High Speed Rail start of revenue service in January 2007.
column2: 2007年1月台灣高鐵開始商業營運之後，由於往台中與嘉義的乘客人數大幅下降，這兩條航線於2007年中停止服務。

column1: Passenger volume decreased from 6.7 million in 2006 to 4.4 million in 2007 (a 34% decrease).
Also due to the opening of the high speed rail line, on 1 March 2008, Uni Air suspended its service to Kaohsiung, while Far Eastern Air Transport suspended its service to Tainan.
column2: 同時在高鐵開始營運的影響下， 2008年3月1日起，立榮航空停止飛往高雄的服務，遠東航空則停止飛往台南的服務。

column1: TransAsia Airways decided to stop flights to Tainan and Kaohsiung after 1 August 2008.
column2: 復興航空則決定自2008年8月1日起，停止飛航台南與高雄。

column1: In early 1999 when the construction of Taipei 101 had just started, Taiwan's Civil Aeronautics Administration changed this airport's certain SID and STAR procedures to avoid possible collision with the building.
column2: 1999年初當台北101開始興建時，台灣民用航空局改變機場的某些 SID 與 STAR 程序， 避免可能的撞擊事件。

column1: The 677-meter Fuxing North Road Underground Passage (復興北路車行地下道) was constructed between 1997 and 2006 under this airport's runway to link the north and south side of this airport.
column2: 677公尺長的復興北路車行地下道，於1997到2006年之間在機場跑道下方施工，以聯通該機場的南端和北端。

column1: Regular cross-Strait charter flights to China started on 4 July 2008, with Songshan receiving the majority of flights.
column2: 自 2008年7月4日起飛往中國的定期跨海峽包機開始飛行， 大部分班機在松山機場起降。

column1: Direct flights to China were an issue of contention.
column2: 往中國的直飛班機是爭論的焦點。

column1: Then-mayor Ma Ying-jeou had been pressing to make Songshan Airport Taipei's main International terminal, citing that its location close to the city center would make it preferable for business travelers.
column2: 剈市長馬英九曾經推動松山機場成為台北主要的國際機場，因為該機場靠近台北市中心，對商務旅客來說非常方便。

column1: However, building height restrictions around the airport raised concerns about flight safety, blocking of radio communications, noise pollution, and a reduced number of flights.
column2: 然而， 機場附近的建築線高造成諸如飛航安全問題、 無線電通訊阻擾、 噪音污染， 必須減少航班。

column1: The continuing growth of Taipei City means that Songshan airport is situated in the heart of downtown Taipei.
column2: 台北市區的不斷成長，也使得松山機場所在地變成台北市中心區域。

column1: Compared to Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport, Songshan Airport saves travelers about 30 minutes due to its location inside Taipei City's central business district, but the city suffers from the noise, pollution, restrictions on urban planning, and traffic congestion the airport brings about.
column2: 和台灣桃園國際機場相比，松山機場讓旅客節省約30分鐘，因為他就正在市區正中心的商業區；但是機場也為台北市帶來噪音、污染、 都市計劃限制和交通擁擠等問題。

column1: In the 2002 and 2006 Taipei Mayor Election DPP candidates Lee Ying-yuan and Frank Hsieh both proposed the plan to close Songshan Airport, and developed its land into road, huge park, detention basin and sports arena, since the Taiwan High Speed Rail could quickly take up the traffic load between Taipei and western Taiwan cities, and the remaining service to outlying islands and eastern Taiwan could be easily taken over by the Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport after the completion of Taoyuan International Airport Access MRT System by the end of 2016.
column2: 2002年與2006年，民進黨的台北市長候選人李應元與謝長廷，兩人都主張關閉松山機場，將其用地發展為道路、大型公園、 滯洪池與運動區， 因為台灣高鐵可以快速承擔台北到其他台灣西部城市的交通，而在桃園國際機場捷運在2016年底完成之後，松山機場剩餘的功能，包括飛往離島與台灣東部，可以由台灣桃園國際機場取代。

column1: Also, the MRT system will make the international potential of Songshan airport less attractive.
column2: 同時，機場捷運也會讓松山機場的國際航線功能變得比較沒有吸引力。

column1: The Songshan Airport closing proposal was deferred under the Taipei City Government which has long been dominated by the Pan-Blue Coalition, who prefers the downtown airport connection concept with Shanghai, Seoul, and Tokyo.
column2: 長期由泛藍陣營執政的台北市政府，則反對關閉松山機場的提案， 他們比較偏好以市區機場連接上海、首爾、東京的構想。

column1: Due to the introduction of Taiwan-China flights and future international potential, the airport is undergoing extensive renovations, the first phase of which is expected to be completed by October 2010.
column2: 由於導入台灣中國直飛航線以及未來國際航線的需求，該機場正在進行大規模的改建，第一期預計在2010年10月前完成。

column1: The second and third phase renovations are expected to be completed by March and October 2011, respectively.
column2: 第二期與第三期改建將分別於2011年3月與10月完成。

column1: However, as of November 2011 renovations are still in progress.
column2: 然而，截至2011年11月為止，改建工程仍在進行中。

column1: A new international cargo terminal is being built in anticipation of a new air route between Taiwan and Japan.
column2: 目前正在興建一個全新的國際貨運航廈，將成為台灣與日本間的新空運路線。

column1: The unused Terminal 2 was refurbished to accommodate arriving flights while the main Terminal, now Terminal 1, was rearranged to handle increased passenger traffic.
column2: 在主航廈（現為第一航廈） 重新改建以容納更多乘客的同時，未使用的第二航廈則改建以容納入境航班。

column1: On 29 March 2011, the renovated Terminal 2 was re-opened to handle domestic flights.
column2: 2011年3月29日，重新改建的第二航廈重新開幕，供國內航線使用。

column1: Songshan Airport is seen to have the potential to attract business travelers within Pacific Asia due to its location in downtown Taipei.
column2: 松山機場因為位於台北市區，對於亞太區的商務旅客相當有吸引力。

column1: Flights to Bangkok–Don Mueang, Jakarta–Halim Perdanakusuma, Kuala Lumpur–Subang, Singapore–Seletar, Nagoya–Komaki, Osaka–Itami, Seoul–Gimpo, Shanghai–Hongqiao, Beijing–Nanyuan, and Tokyo–Haneda are especially attractive since these airports are also in the central areas of their respective cities, and all these cities have larger far flung international airports.
column2: 飛往曼谷廊曼、 雅加達哈林帕達納克蘇瑪國際機場、吉隆坡梳邦機場、 新加坡實里達機場、 名古屋小牧機場、 大阪伊丹機場、 首爾金浦機場、上海虹橋機場，北京南苑機場、東京羽田機場的航班特別受歡迎， 因為這些機場都位在市中心， 在較遠的郊區有更大的國際機場。

column1: The airport is currently in the process of expansion to better accommodate international flights.
column2: 該機場目前正在擴建，以容納更多國際航班。

column1: On 6 March 2009, Japan and Taiwan signed a Memorandum of Understanding on the revision of Taiwan–Japan bilateral traffic.
column2: 2009年3月6日，日本與台灣簽訂合作備忘錄，以改善台灣跟日本之間的雙邊交通。

column1: Four carriers (EVA Air, China Airlines, Japan Airlines, and ANA) would be able to operate from Songshan Airport to Tokyo–Haneda.
column2: 四家航空公司（長榮航空、中華航空、日本航空、全日空）將執飛自松山機場到東京羽田機場的航線。

column1: In December 2009, an affirmative schedule for the route between Tokyo–Haneda and Taipei–Songshan was announced.
column2: 2009年12月， 東京羽田機場與台北松山機場之間的確定航班行程表對外公布。

column1: Starting in October 2010, EVA Air, China Airlines, Japan Airlines, and ANA each operates two flights a day from Taipei–Songshan to Tokyo–Haneda, with China Airlines and EVA Air both utilizing the Airbus A330-300 on the route.
column2: 自2010年10月起，長榮航空、中華航空、日本航空、全日空， 每天有兩班從台北松山機場至東京羽田機場，中華航空與長榮航空都使用空中巴士 A330-300 型客機。

column1: Japan Airlines and ANA began this route with the Boeing 767.
column2: 日本航空與全日空以波音767飛行此航線。

column1: Both ANA and Japan Airlines have phased in the newer Boeing 787-8 on the route beginning in 2013 and 2014, respectively.
column2: 全日空與日本航空各自從2013年與2014年起，以較新的波音787-8飛行本航線。

column1: Japan Airlines also uses the Boeing 777-200 on this route.
column2: 日本航空也使用波音777-200飛行此航線。

column1: On 14 June 2010, direct flights between Taipei–Songshan and Shanghai–Hongqiao began.
column2: 2010年6月14日起，台北松山與上海虹橋之間的直飛航線開始飛行。

column1: Each week has 28 flights, served by China Eastern Airlines, Shanghai Airlines, Air China, China Airlines, EVA Air, and TransAsia Airways.
column2: 由中國東方航空、上海航空、中國航空、長榮航空、復興航空，每星期飛行28班次。

column1: The airport will undergo upgrades to its runway and reduce its jet bridges from eight to six to accommodate wider contemporary aircraft such as the Airbus A330 and Boeing 767.
column2: 該機場正在進行跑道升級，並且將空橋由八個減少為六個，以容納較大型的當代飛機，例如空中巴士A330與波音767。

column1: The airport is served by the Taipei Metro Neihu Line's Songshan Airport Station.
column2: 台北捷運內湖線的松山機場站通過本機場。

column1: The TRA Songshan Airport Line also formerly served Songshan Airport from 1936 until 1976.
column2: 1936年到1976年間，台鐵松山機場線也曾經經過松山機場。

column1: Several city buses also serve this airport, providing frequent links to the Tamsui Line and Wenshan Line of the Taipei Metro.
column2: 多條市區公車路線有經過機場， 班次眾多，提供往台北捷運淡水線與文湖線的便捷交通。

column1: The first suncakes were made by the Lin family in the She-Ko area of Shengang Township, Taichung County (now part of Taichung City).
column2: 太陽餅首先是由位於台中縣神岡鄉社口地區（現為台中市轄區內）的林家製作。

column1: The Lin family used condensed malt sugar as a filling for cake pastries.
column2: 林家使用濃縮的麥芽糖作為太陽餅的內餡。

column1: Later on, pastry maker Wei Qing-hai modified the cakes to their current form.
column2: 之後糕餅師傅魏慶海將其改變為現在的形式。

column1: Though not originally called "suncakes", they were given the name by the owner of "Sun Booth", one of the most famous pastry shops that sells them.
column2: 原本並不叫做太陽餅， 這個名字是由一家也販售這種糕餅的店舖「太陽堂」所取的。

column1: The name was not trademarked, and other pastry shops have used the same name for their own suncakes.
column2: 這個名字並沒有註冊商標，因此其他的糕餅店也用相同名字來賣他們的太陽餅。

column1: Shenyang literally means "the Yang side of the Shen River", referring to the location of the Hun River (formerly called the Shen River, 瀋水; Shěn Shuǐ), on the southern side of the city.
column2: 瀋陽意思是指「瀋水的陽側」，也就是指渾河在該市的南側。

column1: According to Chinese tradition, a river's north bank and a mountain's south slope are considered to be the "sunny" – or "Yang" – side.
column2: 根據中國傳統，河流的北岸或是山的南坡，都稱為「陽」側。

column1: Archaeological findings show that humans resided in present-day Shenyang as early as 8,000 years ago.
column2: 考古發掘指出瀋陽現在的所在地，早在8000年前就有人類居住。

column1: The remains of the Xinle culture, a late neolithic period society over 6,800–7,200 years old, are located in a museum in the north part of Huanggu District.
column2: 新樂文化遺址是約6800年到7200年前的新石器時代社會，位在皇姑區北邊的博物館內。

column1: It is complemented by a recreated village on site.
column2: 在遺址上有一個重建的村落。

column1: A wood-sculptured bird unearthed there is the earliest cultural relic in Shenyang, as well as one of oldest wood sculptures found anywhere in the world.
column2: 從椅子底下挖出的木雕鳥，成為瀋陽最早的文物，也是在全球各地發現的最早的木雕作品之一。

column1: The city, now known as Shenyang, was first established in about 300 BCE during the Warring States period by Yan general Qin Kai, who conquered the Liaodong region, and was then named Hou City (侯城; Hóu Chéng).
column2: 這個城市現在稱為瀋陽，由燕國將領泰開建於西元前三百年左右， 當時秦開攻略遼東地區， 並將該地名為侯城。

column1: However, around 350 years later during the reign of Emperor Guangwu of Han, the city was sacked and burnt by the Donghu nomads and subsequently abandoned.
column2: 然而在漢光武帝統治後的350年後，該城遭到東胡遊牧民族劫掠焚燒， 之後遭到放棄。

column1: It came back to prominence during early Liao dynasty and was known as the Shen Prefecture (瀋州; Shěn Zhōu) through to the end of Jin dynasty, and became the Shenyang Circuit (瀋陽路; Shěnyáng Lù) during the Yuan dynasty.
column2: 該城在遼朝初年重新恢復榮景，到金末期間稱為瀋州，在元朝成為瀋陽路。

column1: During the Ming dynasty, it was designated as a "guard town" (militarized settlements, such as walled/heavily garrisoned cities or towns) named Shenyang Central Guard (瀋陽中衛; Shěnyáng Zhōngwèi) and gradually became one of the most important strongholds beyond the Shanhai Pass.
column2: 明代，該城被指定為為「衛城」（具備軍事設施的城市，例如城牆、重兵駐守）， 稱為瀋陽中衛， 並且逐漸成為山海關外最重要的軍事據點。

column1: In 1625, the Manchu leader Nurhaci captured Shenyang and decided to relocate his entire administrative infrastructures to the city, or Simiyan hoton (Manchu: ᠰᡳᠮᡳᠶᠠᠨ
column2: 1625年，滿州領袖努爾哈赤佔領瀋陽， 並將整個行政架構移到該城，在滿語中又稱  Simiyan hoton (滿語： ᠰᡳᠮᡳᠶᠠᠨ

column1: ᡥᠣᡨᠣᠨ) as it is called in Manchu language.
column2: ᡥᠣᡨᠣᠨ) 。

column1: The official name was changed to Shengjing (盛京; Shèng Jīng; 'rising capital'), or Mukden (Manchu: ᠮᡠᡴ᠋ᡩᡝᠨ), in 1634.
column2: 1634年，官方名稱正式更改為盛京，或是滿語的 Mukden ( ᠮᡠᡴ᠋ᡩᡝᠨ)。

column1: The new name derives from the Manchu word, mukdembi (Manchu: ᠮᡠᡴ᠋ᡩᡝᠮᠪᡳ), meaning "to rise" as reflected also by its Han Chinese name.
column2: 新的名稱 mukdembi ( ᠮᡠᡴ᠋ᡩᡝᠮᠪᡳ) 在滿語中的意思是上升， 也符合其漢語名字。

column1: Under Nurhaci's orders, the Imperial Palace was constructed in 1626, symbolizing the city's emerging status as the Jurchen political center.
column2: 1626年，努爾哈赤下令建造皇宮， 象徵改成成為女真人的政治中心。

column1: The palace featured more than 300 ostentatiously decorated rooms and 20 gardens as a symbol of power and grandeur.
column2: 這座宮殿擁有三百多間裝飾華麗的宮室，和二十座花園，是權力和豐功偉業的象徵。

column1: After the fall of the Ming dynasty in 1644 and the routing of the Shun army in the Battle of Shanhai Pass merely a day later, the Manchus successfully entered the Shanhai Pass to establish the Qing dynasty in China proper, with the capital relocated to Beijing.
column2: 在1644年明朝滅亡，順朝軍在山海關之戰僅一天後，滿洲軍隊順利進入山海關，並且在中國土地上建立清朝，國都遷往北京。

column1: However, Shenyang retained considerable importance as the secondary capital and the spiritual home of the Qing dynasty through the centuries.
column2: 然而瀋陽仍然非常重要，不僅是陪都，同時也是幾個世紀來清朝的精神所在地。

column1: Treasures of the royal house were kept at its palaces, and the tombs of the early Qing rulers were once among the most famous monuments in China.
column2: 王室的寶藏儲存在宮殿裡，清初統治者的墳墓曾經是中國最著名的紀念碑之一。

column1: In 1657, Fengtian Prefecture (奉天府; Fèngtiān Fŭ; Manchu: ᠠᠪᡴᠠᡳ
column2: 1657 年，奉天府 （滿語: ᠠᠪᡴᠠᡳ

column1: ᡳᠮᡳᠶᠠᠩᡤᠠ
column2: ᡳᠮᡳᠶᠠᠩᡤᠠ

column1: ᡶᡠ; Möllendorff: abkai imiyangga fu; Abkai: abkai imiyangga fu or Manchu: ᡶᡠᠩ ᡨᡳᠶᠠᠨ; Möllendorff: fung tiyian; Abkai: fung tiyian) was established in the Shenyang area, and Fengtian (literally: 'mandated by Heaven') was sometimes used synonymously with Shenyang/Mukden.
column2: 在瀋陽地區建立， 有時奉天就是瀋陽和 Mukden 的同義詞。

column1: After the First Sino-Japanese War, Japan coerced the annexation of the Liaodong Peninsula with the Treaty of Shimonoseki in 1895, though was forced to give it up due to diplomatic pressure from the Triple Intervention.
column2: 第一次中日戰爭後，日本於1895年以《馬關條約》脅迫吞併遼東半島，但由於三國干預的外交壓力，日本被迫放棄該條約。

column1: In the aftermath of the Japanese threat, Qing viceroy Li Hongzhang visited Moscow in 1896 and signed a secret treaty with Russian foreign minister Aleksey Lobanov-Rostovsky, allowing Imperial Russia to build a Russian gauge railway in Manchuria, which opened the door towards further Russian expansionism in the form of another lease convention in 1898, effectively allowing Russia to annex Port Arthur in all but name.
column2: 在日本威脅之後，清朝總督李鴻章於1896年訪問了莫斯科，並與俄羅斯外交部長阿列克謝・洛巴諾夫-羅斯托夫斯基簽署密約，允許俄羅斯帝國在滿洲建造一條俄羅斯軌距鐵路，這為1898年以另一項租賃公約的形式進一步的俄羅斯擴張主義打開了大門，讓俄羅斯除了名義上以外，完全有效吞併旅順口區。

column1: However, after the Boxer Rebellion in 1900, Russian forces used the anti-foreigner insurgency as a pretext to formally invade and occupied most of Manchuria, and Mukden became a Russian stronghold in the Far East with the building of the South Manchurian Railway.
column2: 然而，1900年義和團之亂後，俄羅斯軍隊以對抗外國入侵為藉口，正式入侵佔領了滿洲大部分地區，隨著南滿鐵路的建設， 瀋陽成為俄羅斯在遠東的據點。

column1: During the Russo-Japanese War (1904—1905), Mukden was the site of the Battle of Mukden from February 19 to March 10, 1905. Involving more than 600,000 combat participants, it was the largest battle since the Battle of Leipzig in 1813, and also the largest modern-era battle ever fought in Asia before World War II.
column2: 在日俄戰爭（1904-1905年）期間，瀋陽是1905年2月19日至3月10日瀋陽戰役的發生地。這是自1813年萊比錫戰役以來規模最大的戰役，60多萬人參加戰鬥，也是二戰前亞洲有史以來規模最大的現代戰役。

column1: Following the Japanese victory, Mukden became one of the chief bases of Japanese presence and economic expansion into southern Manchuria.
column2: 日本獲勝後，瀋陽成為日本向滿洲南部進行占領與經濟擴張的主要基地之一。

column1: It also became the government seat of Fengtian province in 1910.
column2: 1910年成為奉天省省會。

column1: In 1914, the city changed back to its old name Shenyang, but continued to be known as Mukden (sometimes spelled Moukden) in some English sources and in Japan through much of the first half of 20th century.
column2: 1914年，該城市回復舊名瀋陽，但在20世紀上半葉的大部分時間裡，在一些英語和日本文獻中，還是稱之為 Mukden（有時拼寫為Moukden）。

column1: The postmark of the Chinese postal administration kept the spelling "MOUKDEN/奉天" for usage on international mails until the late 1920s.
column2: 直到20世紀20年代末，中國郵政當局的國際郵件郵戳一直保留「MOUKDEN/奉天」的拼寫方式。

column1: After that, a Chinese–Manchurian bilingual type "SHENYANG (MUKDEN)/瀋陽 (奉天)" datestamp was used until 1933.
column2: 此後，中文-滿洲語雙語型的「瀋陽（MUKDEN）/瀋陽（奉天）」日期戳章一直沿用到1933年。

column1: In the early 20th century, Shenyang began expanding out of its old city walls.
column2: 20世紀初期，瀋陽開始將其城區擴展到舊城牆之外。

column1: The Shenyang Railway Station on the South Manchurian Railway and the Shenyang North Railway Station on the Jingfeng Railway, both west of the old city, became the new commercial centers of Shenyang.
column2: 南滿鐵路上的瀋陽車站，以及京奉鐵路上的瀋陽北站，兩站都在舊城區的西邊，成為瀋陽的新商業中心。

column1: In the 1920s, Mukden was the capital of the warlord Zhang Zuolin, who was later assassinated when his train was blown up on 4 June 1928 at a Japanese-guarded railway bridge.
column2: 在1920年代，瀋陽成為軍閥張作霖的都城，1928年6月4日，張作霖在 在自己的火車經過由日本軍看守的鐵路橋上遭到炸死。

column1: At the time, several factories were built by Zhang to manufacture ammunition in the northern and eastern suburbs.
column2: 當時，張作霖在北邊與東邊的郊區設立數個軍火工廠。

column1: These factories laid the foundation for Shenyang's industrial development.
column2: 這些工廠成為瀋陽工業發展的基礎。

column1: At around 10:20 pm on 18 September 1931, a small quantity of dynamite was detonated close to a railway line near Mukden owned by the Japanese South Manchuria Railway Company by Kwantung Army Lt.
column2: 1931年9月18日午後10:20 左右， 在日本南滿鐵路公司接近奉天的鐵路上，有一小包炸藥被引爆。

column1: Kawamoto Suemori.
column2: 引爆人是日本關東軍中尉何本末守。

column1: The Imperial Japanese Army, accusing Chinese dissidents of the act, then use the false flag explosion as pretext to launch a full attack on Mukden, and captured the city the following morning (September 19).
column2: 日本帝國陸軍指責中國持不同政見者的行為，然後以假旗幟爆炸當做藉口對奉天發動全面攻擊，並在第二天早上（9月19日）佔領了該市。

column1: After the Mukden Incident, the Japanese further invaded and occupied the rest of Northeast China, and created the puppet state of Manchukuo with the deposed emperor Aisin Gioro Puyi as the figurehead.
column2: 奉天事件發生後，日本人進一步入侵並佔領東北地區，並建立了傀儡國滿洲國，由退位皇帝愛新覺羅・溥儀擔任傀儡。

column1: During the Manchukuo era (1932–1945), the city was again called Fengtian (and Mukden in English), and was developed by the Japanese into a center of heavy industry.
column2: 在滿洲國時代（1932-1945年），這座城市再次被稱為奉天（英語為Mukden），日本人將其發展成為重工業中心。

column1: Japan was able to exploit resources in Manchuria using the extensive network of railroads.
column2: 日本人可以透過綿密的鐵路網，榨取滿洲里的資源。

column1: For example, vast expanses of Manchurian forest were chopped down.
column2: 舉例來說，滿洲里有大量的森林遭到砍伐。

column1: The development of Shenyang was also unbalanced in this period; municipal facilities were mostly located in Japanese residential areas, while Chinese residential areas had poor living conditions.
column2: 這個時期的瀋陽發展也非常不均衡；各種是正設施多半集中於日本人的居住區，而中國人居住的地方生活條件非常差。

column1: Under Marshal of the Soviet Union Aleksandr Vasilevsky, the Far East Command of Soviet forces entered Manchuria in early August 1945 following the surrender of Japan.
column2: 在蘇聯元帥Aleksandr Vasilevsky的主政下，在日本投降後，蘇聯軍隊遠東司令部於1945年8月初進入滿洲。

column1: On 16 August 1945, Manchurian Emperor Puyi was captured in Shenyang Airport by the Soviet Red Army while he was in an airplane fleeing to Japan.
column2: 1945年8月16日，滿州皇帝溥儀在準備逃亡到日本的飛機中，在瀋陽機場被蘇聯紅軍逮捕。

column1: On 20 August, Soviet troops captured Shenyang.
column2: 8月20日，蘇聯軍隊佔領瀋陽。

column1: British and US reports indicate that the Soviet troops that occupied Northeast China and Eastern Inner Mongolia region looted and terrorized the people of Shenyang, and were not discouraged by Soviet authorities from "three days of rape and pillage".
column2: 英國和美國的報告指出，佔領東北和內蒙古東部地區的蘇聯軍隊，對 瀋陽居民進行搶劫和恐嚇，蘇聯當局沒有阻止連續「三天的強姦掠奪」。

column1: The Soviets were replaced by the Nationalist Chinese, who were flown in on U.S. transport planes.
column2: 蘇聯被乘坐美國運輸機的國民黨軍取代。

column1: During the Chinese Civil War, Shenyang remained a Kuomintang stronghold from 1946 to 1948, although the Chinese communists controlled the surrounding countryside.
column2: 在中國內戰期間，瀋陽從1946年到1948年一直是國民黨的據點，不過中國共產黨控制了周圍的農村。

column1: It was captured by the communists on October 30, 1948, following a series of offensives known as the Liaoshen Campaign.
column2: 在一連串稱作遼西會戰的攻擊後，共產黨於1948年10月30日佔領瀋陽。

column1: Over the past 200 years or so, Shenyang managed to grow and increase its industrial might, despite consecutive wars with Russia and Japan in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, the Second World War, and China's Civil War (Shenyang became the main battleground between the Communists and Nationalists).
column2: 在過去的200年左右的時間裡，儘管在19世紀末和20世紀初與俄羅斯和日本連續發生戰爭，又歷娙第二次世界大戰和中國內戰（瀋陽成為共產黨和國民黨間的主要戰場），瀋陽還是設法增長並強化其工業實力。

column1: The old city of Shenyang resided almost entirely within the modern day Shenhe District, and used to have two city walls.
column2: 瀋陽舊城幾乎完全居於在當代的瀋河區，曾有兩道城牆。

column1: Situated roughly within the area bounded by the four "Shuncheng" (顺城; 'along the city walls') roads/streets in Shenhe District, the (now-demolished) square-shaped inner city wall marked the bounds of ancient Shenyang.
column2: （現已拆除的）方形內城牆，大致位於瀋河區四條「順城」道路/街道的範圍內，代表著舊時瀋陽的邊界。

column1: The earliest wall was built in 926 during early Liao dynasty to settle Northern Song civilians the Khitans abducted from raids to use as slave labourers, and was then made of rammed earth because the city was merely a small settlement at the time (historically the administrative center of the Liaodong region was at Liaoyang).
column2: 最早的城牆建於926年，在遼朝早期，用於安置由契丹人突襲中綁架而來的北宋居民，用作奴工；城牆由夯土製成，因為當時這座城市只是一個小據點（歷史上，遼東地區的行政中心在遼陽）。

column1: However, in 1368, Hongwu Emperor of the newly founded Ming dynasty ordered a new regional military command—the Liaodong Regional Military Commission (遼東都指揮使司)—to be established, and Shenyang was made a prominent regional "guard town" (衛所).
column2: 然而，1368年，新建國的明朝洪武皇帝，下令成立一個新的地區軍事指揮部——遼東都指揮使司，瀋陽成為一個著名的區域衛所。

column1: In 1388, Min Zhong (閔忠), the newly appointed city commissioner of the Shenyang Central Guard, wrote to Hongwu Emperor immediately upon his tenure requesting permission to upgrade the city wall, and the old wall was made taller and thoroughly reinforced with overlaid bricks.
column2: 1388年，瀋陽中央衛隊新任命的行政首長閔忠，在上任後立即上書給洪武皇帝，請求准許升級城牆，舊城牆變得更高，並以磚塊覆蓋徹底加固。

column1: According to History of Ming, the reconstructed Ming-era wall was 2.5 zhàngs (8 metres or 26 feet) tall, more than 1 zhàng (3.2 metres or 10.5 feet) wide at the top, and 9 lis and 30 bus (about 5.2 kilometres or 3.2 miles) long.
column2: 根據明朝歷史，重建的明代城牆高2.5丈（8米或26英尺），頂部寬超過1丈（3.2米或10.5英尺），長9里和30步（約5.2公里或3.2英里）。

column1: It has two layers of moats dug outside, each being 3 zhàngs (9.6 metres or 31.5 feet) wide and 8 chis (2.56 metres or 8 feet 4.8 inches) deep, fed with water from Shen River.
column2: 城外挖了兩層護城河，每層寬3丈（9.6米或31.5英尺），深8丈（2.56米或8英尺4.8英寸），灌入瀋河的水。

column1: There were four city gates, each at the center of one side, connected by two main roads that intersected at Central Temple of the city's center in a "+" fashion.
column2: 有四個城門，每道城門都在一邊的中心點，由兩條主要道路相連；兩條主要道路以「+」的方式在市中心的中央寺廟交會。

column1: This Ming wall was heavily damaged in 1625 after the Manchu laid siege and captured the city, with only the north wall and gate (which had undergone reinforcing reconstructions in 1545 under the orders of Jiajing Emperor) remained intact.
column2: 1625年滿洲人包圍並佔領該市後，這堵明城牆嚴重受損，只有北牆和大門（在嘉靖皇帝命令下，在1545年進行強化重建）完好無損。

column1: The Manchu leader Nurhachi however saw the strategic value of the city, and decided to formally relocate his Later Jin capital from Liaoyang to Shenyang, and ordered the city wall to be rebuilt.
column2: 然而，滿族領袖努爾哈赤看出這座城市的戰略價值，決定將金朝首都從遼陽正式遷至瀋陽，並下令重建城牆。

column1: According to Annals of Mukden (盛京通志), the new city wall was a standard black brick wall standing at a height of 3.5 zhàngs (about 12.5 metres or 41.0 feet), a width of 1.8 zhàngs (about 6.4 metres or 21.0 feet) and a total length of 9 lis and 332 bus (about 6.4 kilometres or 4.0 miles) long, complete with 12 towers (8 gate and 4 corner) and a 14.5 zhàngs (about 52-metre or 171-foot) wide moat.
column2: 根據《盛京通志》，新城牆是一堵標準的黑磚牆，高度為3.5 丈（約12.5米或41.0英尺），寬度為1.8 丈（約6.4米或21.0英尺），總長度為9 里 332 步（約6.4公里或4.0英里），配有12座塔樓（8個大門和4個角落），護城河寬 14.5 丈（約52米或171英尺）。

column1: The city gates were increased from four to eight, though the old Ming-era north gate and tower was preserved but sealed shut, later known as the "Ninth Gate" (九門).
column2: 後城門從四個增加到八個，儘管古老的明時代北門和塔樓保留下來，但密封關閉，後來稱為「九門」。

column1: The outer city wall, called the "peripheral wall" (邊牆; Biān Qiáng) or "pass wall" (關牆; Guān Qiáng), was actually a rammed earth rampart built in 1680 to expand the urban area outside the inner city.
column2: 外城牆稱為「邊牆」或「關牆」，實際上是一座建於1680年的夯土牆，旨在將城區擴及內城之外。

column1: It was almost round in shape, standing at a height of 7.5 chis (around 2.7 metres or 8 feet 10.3 inches) and an overall length of 32 lis and 24 bus (about 20.7 kilometres or 12.9 miles), and also had eight gates known as the "peripheral gates" (邊門; Biān Mén).
column2: 它大致是圓形的，高度為7.5尺（約2.7米或8英尺10.3英寸），總長度為32英里24步（約20.7公里或12.9英里），還有8個被稱為「邊門」。

column1: The corresponding inner and outer gates were linked by roads that intersected within the inner city in a "#" pattern around the Mukden Palace.
column2: 對應的內門和外門之間，連結有在城內交叉的道路，在瀋陽故宮周圍以「#」圖案交叉。

column1: Nearly all of these city walls and gates were demolished after 1949.
column2: 所有的城牆和城門，在1949年後幾乎都被摧毁。

column1: Two gates and one corner tower of the inner wall were rebuilt during the 1990s.
column2: 1990年代， 內城牆有兩個城門和一個角落的塔樓重建起來。

column1: There had, however, been proposals to rebuild the other gates and towers in preparation to the 12th National Games in 2013.
column2: 然而，有人提議重建其他大門和塔樓，為2013年 中華人民共和國第12屆運動會做準備。

column1: Around 2.5 km (1.6 mi) outside Shenyang's former outer wall, there were four pagodas each located within an associated Tibetan buddhist temple, namely the East Pagoda in Yongguang Temple (永光寺), the South Pagoda in Guangci Temple (廣慈寺), the West Pagoda in Yanshou Temple (延壽寺) and the North Pagoda in Falun Temple (法輪寺).
column2: 在瀋陽舊外牆外約2.5公里（1.6英里），有四座寶塔，各自位於相關的藏傳佛教寺內，即永光寺的東塔、廣慈寺的南塔、延壽寺的西塔和法輪寺的北塔。

column1: They were built in 1643 and completed in 1645.
column2: 這些寶塔於1643年開始興建，於1645年完成。

column1: The four pagodas are identical white Buddha-stupas as tall as 26 m (85 ft).
column2: 這四座寶塔是相同的白色佛像，高達26米（85英尺）。

column1: Nowadays only the temple for the North Pagoda is well preserved, the East and South has only the pagodas left, and the temple for the West Pagoda was rebuilt in 1998.
column2: 如今，只有北塔的寺廟保存完好，東邊和南邊只剩下寶塔，西塔的寺廟於1998年重建。

column1: Both the Temple of Heaven and Temple of Earth were also to be found in the old city during the Qing dynasty.
column2: 清朝期間，在舊城區也有天壇和地壇。

column1: They were smaller replicas of Beijing's counterparts.
column2: 其為北京天壇地壇的縮小版。

column1: Neither exists today.
column2: 今日都不復存。

column1: Shenyang ranges in latitude from 41° 11' to 43° 02' N and in longitude from 122° 25' to 123° 48' E, and is located in the central part of Liaoning province.
column2: 瀋陽的緯度為北緯41°11'至43°02'，經度為東經122°25'至123°48'，位於遼寧省中部。

column1: The western parts of the city's administrative area are located on the alluvial plain of the Liao River system, while the eastern part consists of the hinterlands of the Changbai Mountains, and is covered with forests.
column2: 該市行政區的西部，位於遼河水系的沖積平原上，而東部由長白山脈的腹地組成，上有森林覆蓋。

column1: The highest point in Shenyang is 414 m (1,358 ft) above sea level and the lowest point only 7 m (23 ft).
column2: 瀋陽的最高點海拔414米（1,358英尺），最低點只有7米（23英尺）。

column1: The average elevation of the urban area is 45 m (148 ft).
column2: 市區平均海拔為45米（148英呎）。

column1: The city's main urban area is located to the north of Hun River, formerly the largest tributary of the Liao River proper and often locally referred as the city's "mother river".
column2: 該市的主要城區位於渾河以北，渾河以前是遼河本身最大的支流，在當地通常稱為該市的「母河」。

column1: The central urban area is surrounded by three artificial rivers—respectively the South Canal (南运河) from the south and southeast, the Xinkai River (新开河, formerly the North Canal) from the north and northeast, and the Weigong River (卫工河, formerly the Weigong Nullah) from the west, all interconnected by channels as a continuous waterway.
column2: 城市中心被三條人工開挖的河流包圍——分別是南面、東南面的南運河、北面和東北面的新開河（前北運河）和西邊的衛工明渠，彼此相連為一條連續的水道。

column1: The South Canal in particular, famous for the series of linear parks and gardens along it, was constructed upon the old course of the Wanquan River (萬泉河; 'ten thousand springs river'), historically also called the Little Shen River (小瀋水) or Wuli River (五里河; 'five-li river'), which was a principal water source for the old city.  These are reinforced on the peripheries by smaller rivers such as Xi River (细河), Puhe River (蒲河) and Mantang River (满堂河), and drains into the Hun River at three different locations on the southeast, due south and southwest side of the city.
column2: 特別是南運河，以其沿線的成排公園和花園而聞名，建在萬泉河的舊河道上，歷史上也被稱為小瀋河或五里河，是舊城區的主要水源。外側有細河、普河和曼塘河（曼塘河）等較小的河流，在該市的東南側和西南側三個不同位置匯入渾河。

column1: There was also previously another canal on the east side called Huishan Nullah (辉山明渠) that drains into Xinkai River's lower section, but is now no longer existent due to land reclamation from urban constructions.
column2: 以前，東側還有一條名為輝山明渠的運河，流入新開河下段，但由於城市建設的土地開墾，現在已經不復存在。

column1: Shenyang has many parks, among the most famous are the 14.5 km (9.0 mi) South Canal Linear Parks (南运河带状公园) situated along the homonymous river traversing the southern parts of Dadong, Shenhe and Heping District, covering an area of approximately 1,400,000 m² (350 acres).
column2: 瀋陽有許多公園，其中最著名的是14.5公里（9.0英里）的南運河帶狀公園，位於穿越大東區、瀋河區和和平區南側的同名河流沿線，面積約為140萬平方米（350英畝）。

column1: It comprises 6 large parks and 18 riverside gardens, with exotic variety of vegetations such as rose, apricot, bladder cherry, honeylocust, natal lily, scarlet sage, morning glory and black-eyed-Susan, and extensive greenspaces of peach, pear, crabapples, ginkgos, weeping willows, pines and black locusts.
column2: 包括6個大型公園和18個河邊花園，有各種異國情調的植被，如玫瑰、杏桃、酸漿、美國皂莢、大花君子蘭、一串紅、牽牛花和黑心金光菊，以及廣闊綠地，種植桃子、梨、山渣、銀杏、垂柳、松樹和刺槐。

column1: It is the largest stretch of vegetated urban open space in Shenyang, contributing significantly to the city's current 40 percent "greening ratio", and was instrumental in the city being awarded the "national forest city" title in 2005.
column2: 它是瀋陽最大的植被城市開放空間，對該市目前40%的「綠化率」貢獻卓著，並讓該市於2005年獲頒「國家森林城市」頭銜。

column1: According to the Shenyang Environmental Protection Bureau, winter usage of coal by boiler stations for hydronic district heating is the source of 30 percent of the air pollution in Shenyang.
column2: 據瀋陽環境保護局稱，鍋爐站在冬季使用煤炭進行循環溫水供暖，是瀋陽30%空氣汙染的來源。

column1: Half of the 16 million metric tons of coal consumed by the city during the winter of 2013–2014 were used for heating.
column2: 2013-2014年冬季，該市消耗1600萬公噸煤炭，有一半用於供應暖氣。

column1: Other major factors include dust from construction sites (20 percent), vehicle exhaust (20 percent), industrial emissions (10 percent) and extraterritorial dust (20 percent, mostly yellow dust from Gobi Desert).
column2: 其他主要因素包括建築工地的灰塵（20%）、車輛廢氣（20%）、工業排放（10%）和區外塵土（20%，主要是戈壁沙漠的黃色塵土）。

column1: However, air quality was described by the Bureau as "slowly improving".
column2: 不過當局稱空氣品質正在「緩慢改善中」。

column1: The Shenhe District (沈河区; 'Shen River district') is the central area of Shenyang, and currently hosts the seat of the City Government.
column2: 瀋河區是瀋陽的中心地區，目前是市政府所在地。

column1: The old city wall is entirely located in Shenhe District.
column2: 舊城區完全位在瀋河區內。

column1: It has an area of 60 km² (23 sq mi) and a registered population of 716,417 (as per 2014).
column2: 該區的面積為60平方公里( 23平方哩），註冊人口於2014年時有716,417人。

column1: There is the Central Temple (中心庙; Zhōngxīn Mìao), built during the Ming dynasty, showing the center of ancient Shenyang.
column2: 中心廟建於明朝，展現古代瀋陽的中心。

column1: This temple is located just south of the Middle Street (中街; Zhōng Jiē), one of the most famous shopping streets and the first commercial pedestrian zone in China.
column2: 這座寺廟位於中街以南，是中國最著名的購物街之一，也是第一個商業人行道專區。

column1: Shenhe District is also home to the famous Wu'ai Market (五爱市场; Wŭài Shìchǎng), the largest light industry wholesale trading center in the entire Bohai Economic Rim.
column2: 瀋河區也是知名的五愛市場所在地， 是整個渤海經濟圈中最大的輕工業批發交易中心。

column1: Shenhe District is the site of the Mukden Palace, just south of the Central Temple.
column2: 瀋河區也是奉天故宮的所在地，就在中心廟的南邊。

column1: It is also the site of Zhang Zuolin's former home and headquarters, Shengjing Ancient Cultural Street.
column2: 這裡同時也是張作霖故居與盛京舊文化街總部所在地。

column1: He was a sent-down youth in Yunnan during Cultural Revolution.
column2: 他在文化大革命中是往雲南的下放青年。

column1: From 1978 to 1982, he studied at Renmin University of China.
column2: 在1978年到1982年間，他就讀於中國人民大學。

column1: He went to the United States to continue his education in 1984 and received a master's degree from the University of Pittsburgh in 1988.
column2: 1984年，他前往美國繼續攻讀， 1988年在匹茲堡大學獲得碩士學位。

column1: After his return to China, he taught at Peking University and Renmin University of China.
column2: 回到中國後，他在北京大學和中國人民大學任教。

column1: He became a freelance writer in 1992. On April 11, 1997, Wang died of a heart attack in Beijing.
column2: 他在1992年成為自由作家。 1997年4月11日，王曉波因為心臟病死於北京。

column1: Wang Xiaobo wrote several novels, short stories collections and essays, some of which have been translated into English, French and Italian.
column2: 王曉波寫過多本小說、短篇故事集以及論文，某些曾翻譯為英文、法文、義大利文。

column1: He had been writing about the life of people and love, even sex in his understanding.
column2: 他一直在寫關於人的生活和愛，甚至以他的理解來寫性。

column1: He has unique vision.
column2: 他的觀點獨特。

column1: His diction is close to daily life but does not lack of literariness.
column2: 他的措辭接近日常生活，但不缺乏文學性。

column1: As he said:
column2: 如他所說：

column1: “...I believe readers will make a conclusion like that after they read.
column2: 「⋯⋯ 我相信讀者在讀完後也會有類似的結論。

column1: The theme is our life; and at the same time, they will agree that there is no one has ever written our life in this way...As our life should not be like what I wrote, but actually, it is.”
column2: 主題就是我們的生活；同時，他們會同意，沒有人以這種方式寫下我們的生活...... 正如我們的生活不應該像我寫的那樣，但實際上就是如此。」

column1: Some people had commented Wang’s works that though they were interesting, they lack of a positive theme and can not inspire us, etc.
column2: 有些人評論了王的作品，雖然很有趣，但缺乏積極的主題，無法激勵我們，等等。

column1: And Wang responded:
column2: 王回應說：

column1: “Though the author is a modest person, he can not accept those opinions.
column2: 「作者雖然很溫和，但無法接受這種觀點。

column1: Being positive is one of our norm, but it should not be always mentioned.
column2: 積極是我們的規範之一，但不應該總是如此。

column1: I think my duty is writing interesting novels as possible as I can, and should not add some deliberate sermonize.
column2: 我認為我的職責是儘可能地寫有趣的小說，不應該加入一些深思熟慮的大道理。

column1: My writing attitude is to write some works for those people who read novels, not to teach undereducated youth...”
column2: 我的寫作態度是為那些想讀小說的人寫一些作品，而不是要教導未曾受過教育的年輕人⋯⋯」

column1: In ancient times, the Taoyuan plateau was the home of the Taiwanese plains aborigines.
column2: 在古代，桃園台地是臺灣平地原住民的故鄉。

column1: In prehistory, the Ketagalan people settled in Nankan.
column2: 在史前史，凱達格蘭族人住在南崁。

column1: In the early years of Dutch colonization, Spanish colonization, and Zheng He of the Ming Dynasty, there were no large-scale cultivation or industrial activities.
column2: 在荷蘭殖民時代初年、西班牙殖民者，以及明朝的鄭和時代， 並沒有大規模的開墾或工業活動。

column1: During the Qing era, a number of people from Fujian Province and Guangdong province began to immigrate into present-day Taoyuan to develop and farm the land.
column2: 在清朝期間，一群來自福建和廣東的移民，開始在現在的桃園開墾耕種。

column1: They planted peach trees, which, when fully bloomed in spring, were so beautiful that the people named the land Toahong (Chinese: 桃仔園; pinyin: Táozǐyuán; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Thô-á-hn̂g; literally: 'peach orchard').
column2: 他們種植桃樹， 在春天時盛開， 非常美麗，大家把這塊地稱作桃仔園。

column1: In November 1901, under Japanese rule, a local administrative office, Toshien Chō (Japanese: 桃仔園廳), was established in the area, and renamed Tōen Chō (桃園廳) in 1905.
column2: 1901年11月，在日本統治下， 在當地設立桃仔園廳地方行政官署， 1905年改為桃園廳。

column1: In 1920, the Tōen area was incorporated into Shinchiku Prefecture.
column2: 1920年，桃園廳併入新竹州。

column1: During the Japanese era, the staged migration policy caused Taoyuan to develop into a city with a variety of cultures.
column2: 在日本時代，分階段移民政策導致桃園發展成為一個擁有不同文化的城市。

column1: For example, temples and worship paths (currently the Taoyuan Martyrs Shrine) symbolized cultural systems.
column2: 例如，神社和參道（目前是桃園忠烈祠）象徵著文化體系。

column1: Butokuden (武德殿) were used to represent military systems, and the old Taoyuan City Office signified political systems.
column2: 武德殿用以代表軍事制度，舊桃園市役所代表政治制度。

column1: In 1950, Taoyuan County was established by the Republic of China government.
column2: 1950年，中華民國政府設置桃園縣。

column1: On 21 April 1971, Taoyuan City was made the county seat of Taoyuan County.
column2: 1971年4月21日，桃園市成為桃園縣的縣治。

column1: It had 6 cities, 1 urban township and 6 rural townships.
column2: 有6個市、1個鎮和6個鄉。

column1: Being located at the edge of the Greater Taipei region, this caused some structural and lifestyle changes within Taiwanese society.
column2: 由於位於大台北地區的邊陲地帶，使它在臺灣社會中呈現某些結構和生活方式的不同。

column1: Trade prosperity in recent years and the proliferation of job opportunities helped Taoyuan develop into a major economic district in northern Taiwan and the population has increased ever since.
column2: 近年來貿易繁榮和就業機會的激增，使桃園發展成為臺灣北部主要經濟區，此後人口不斷增加。

column1: On 16 February 1998, China Airlines Flight 676 crashed in Taoyaun City near Chiang Kai-shek International Airport (Taoyuan International Airport's former name), killing all 196 people on board and seven more on the ground.
column2: 1998年2月16日，中華航空公司676號班機在中正國際機場（桃園國際機場的前名）附近的桃園市墜毀，機上196人死亡，地面有7人喪生。

column1: On 25 December 2014, Taoyuan County was reorganized into the special municipality of Taoyuan City (桃園市).
column2: 2014年12月25日，桃園縣改制為桃園直轄市。

column1: Taoyuan is located approximately 40 km (25 mi) southwest of Taipei, in northern Taiwan, and occupies 1,220 km² (470 sq mi).
column2: 桃園位於臺灣北部臺北西南約40公里（25英哩），佔地1,220平方公里（470平方英哩）。

column1: It is made up of low-lying plains, interconnected mountains and plateaus.
column2: 由低窪平原、相互連接的山脈和台地組成。

column1: Its shape has a long and narrow southeast-to-northwest trend, with the southeast in the Xueshan Range and the far end on the shores of the Taiwan Strait.
column2: 自東南到西北，形狀呈長而狹窄的走勢，東南為雪山山脈，遠端在臺灣海峽海岸。

column1: There are many irrigation ponds at Taoyuan Plateau, which caused Taoyuan to earn the nickname "Thousand-pond Township" (千塘之鄉).
column2: 桃園台地有許多灌溉池塘，因此桃園有「千塘鄉」之名。

column1: As of most of the cities and urban towns of Taiwan, Minnan people (Hoklos) are one of the largest ethnic groups of Taoyuan, most of whom live in northern Taoyuan (北桃園) which comprises the northern districts of Taoyuan, including Taoyuan city centre, Bade, Daxi, Dayuan, Guishan and Luzhu, and the city seat of government, Taoyuan District citycentre.
column2: 與臺灣的大多數城市和城鎮一樣，福佬人是桃園最大的族群之一，其中大多數人居住在桃園北部（北桃園），包括桃園市中心、八德、大溪、大園、龜山和蘆竹，以及市政府所在地桃園區市中心。

column1: The Hakka are the second-largest ethnic group in the city after the Minnan ethnicity (Hoklo) who won against the Hakkas in clan wars moved to the poor mountainous regions in southern Taoyuan, most of the Hakka peasants live in the rural peasant village areas of southern Taoyuan (南桃園), which includes Zhongli, Pingzhen, Yangmei, Longtan, Guanyin and Xinwu districts.
column2: 客家人是該市第二大族群，僅次於在族群械鬥中戰勝客家的福佬人，他們遷至桃園南部的貧困山區，大多數客家農民居住在桃園南部（南桃園）的農村地區，包括中壢、平鎮、楊梅、龍潭、觀音和新屋區。

column1: With more than 785,000 Hakka people, Taoyuan hosts the largest Hakka population among all of Taiwan's administrative divisions.
column2: 桃園擁有超過785,000名客家人，在臺灣所有行政區中客家人口最多。

column1: After the Chinese Civil War, many people from mainland China (unaffectionately referred to as "Waishengren") settled in the then-Taoyuan County after the retreat of the nationalist government in 1949. Most of them live in military dependents' villages in Zhongli, Pingzhen and Guishan.
column2: 中國內戰後，1949年國民黨政府撤退來台，許多來自中國大陸的人（被稱為「外省人」）定居在當時的桃園縣。 多數人住在中壢、平鎮和龜山的眷村內。

column1: Longgang is well known for its immigrants from Yunnan, featuring many Yunnan-style restaurants.
column2: 龍岡以其來自雲南的移民而聞名，擁有許多雲南式餐廳。

column1: Most Taiwanese aborigines in the city live in Fuxing District, with most of them belonging to the Atayal people.
column2: 該市的多數臺灣原住民居住在復興區，大多數是泰雅人。

column1: Taoyuan is one of the Taiwan's top industrial and technological cities.

column1: High-tech companies including Quanta, MiTAC, Inotera, Nanya Technology, HTC, CPT and AU Optronics have all opted to build or expand their factories in Taoyuan.
column2: 包括廣達、神達、華亞科、南亞科、宏達電、華映和友達在內的高科技公司，都選擇在桃園興建或擴建工廠。

column1: Taoyuan has now become a bastion of electronics and semiconductor manufacturing.

column1: There are over 6,827 ha (16,870 acres) of land available for factories and industrial use in the city, representing the fact that Taoyuan's development bureau is based on industry and commerce.

column1: There are also 9 sites (57 ha; 140 acres) for mixed industrial-commercial use, the most of any county and city in Taiwan.

column1: On 26 March 2010, China Airlines moved into its new headquarters on the grounds of Taipei Taoyuan International Airport and in Dayuan Township in Taoyuan County (now Dayuan District, Taoyuan).

column2: 朱於2005年競選連任，並擊敗了民進黨挑戰者臺灣鹽業公司執行長鄭寶清。

column1: In 2009, John Wu of the KMT defeated his DPP opponent, Cheng Wen-tsan and became the Magistrate of Taoyuan County.
column2: 2009年，國民黨的吳志揚擊敗了民進黨對手鄭文燦，成為桃園縣長。

column1: After the upgrade of Taoyuan County to Taoyuan City, Cheng Wen-tsan of the DPP won the 2014 Taoyuan City mayoralty election, on 29 November 2014, and became the city's first mayor, starting 25 December 2014.
column2: 在桃園縣升級為桃園市後，民進黨的鄭文燦於2014年11月29日贏得了2014年桃園市市長選舉，並從2014年12月25日開始成為該市第一任市長。

column1: A majority of Taoyuan County residents voted for eventual winner Lee Teng-hui and vice president Lien Chan.
column2: 桃園縣大多數居民投票給最終獲勝者李登輝和副總統連戰。

column1: A former RCA facility is located in the city.
column2: 前RCA工廠位於該市。

column1: The RCA facility is the source of significant trichloroethylene contamination.
column2: RCA廠房是三氯乙烯嚴重汙染的來源。

column1: Taoyuan is home to the Lamigo Monkeys, CPBL, team, which plays its home games at the Taoyuan International Baseball Stadium.
column2: 桃園是中華職棒 Lamigo 桃猿隊的所在城市，該隊在桃園國際棒球場進行主場比賽。

column1: The Taoyuan County Stadium, built in 1993, is a multi-use stadium which is used mostly for football matches and it also has an athletics track.
column2: 桃園縣立體育場建於1993年，是一個多功能體育場館，主要用於足球比賽，還有一個田徑場。

column1: The stadium has a capacity of 30,000 people.
column2: 該體育場可容納 30,000 人。

column1: It is within walking distance South West from Taoyuan Senior High School Station of the Taiwan Railway Administration.
column2: 從臺鐵桃園高中車站向西南方步行即可抵達。

column1: The Taoyuan Arena, also built in 1993, is an indoor sporting arena located in Taoyuan District.
column2: 桃園市立田徑場也建於1993年，是一個位於桃園區的室內體育館。

column1: The concept of its roof structure was based on the bicycle structure, the outer ring (to bear pressure) and inner tire (to bear tensile strength) of the bicycle wheels are connected by cable wires.
column2: 其屋頂結構的設計概念來自腳踏車的結構，腳踏車車輪的外圈（承受壓力）和內圈（承受抗拉強度）透過鋼纜連接。

column1: It occupies an area of 1.5 hectare with capacity of 15,000 audiences.
column2: 該館佔地 1.5 公頃，可容納觀眾 15,000 人。

column1: It is used to host indoor sporting events, such as basketball and volleyball.
column2: 該場館用於舉辦室內體育競賽，如籃球和排球。

column1: The then-Taoyuan County is also the birthplace of Taiwanese professional golfer Yani Tseng and taekwondo athlete Chu Mu-Yen.
column2: 當時的桃園縣也是臺灣職業高爾夫選手曾雅妮和跆拳道選手朱木炎的出生地。

column1: National Highway No. 1 and 3 are nearby and connect via local highways to the city itself.
column2: 國道一號與國道三號在此交會，並連結至該市的市區公路。

column1: National Highway No. 2 connects to Taoyuan International Airport.
column2: 國道二號通往桃園國際機場。

column1: Bridges in the city are Luofu Bridge.
column2: 市內也有一座橋樑羅浮橋。

column1: Taipei Taoyuan International Airport at Dayuan District is the largest airport in Taiwan.
column2: 大園區的臺北桃園國際機場是臺灣最大的機場。

column1: It serves as the main international hub for China Airlines and EVA Air.
column2: 它是華航和長榮航空的主要國際樞紐。

column1: Taipei Taoyuan handled a total of 25,114,418 passengers in 2010.
It is the fifteenth-busiest air freight hub in the world and thirteenth-busiest airport by international passenger traffic.
column2: 它是世界第十五大最繁忙的航空貨運樞紐，也是第13大最繁忙的國際客運機場。

column1: Taipei Taoyuan International Airport currently has two terminals which are connected by two, short people movers.
column2: 臺北桃園國際機場目前有兩個航廈，有兩個旅客捷運系統相連。

column1: A third terminal is planned, and a rapid transit system currently under construction will link the terminals together underground.
column2: 正在計劃建造第三航廈，目前建設中的捷運系統，將於地下連接各航廈。

column1: City planners first conceived of, and set aside space for, a park at Central Park's current location during the period when Taiwan was under Japanese rule.
column2: 在日本統治時期，城市規畫人員者首次構思並留出空間，在今中央公園處設立公園。

column1: Later on, planners during the early period of Republic of China rule referred to the concept as Park Number 15.
column2: 後來，在中華民國統治初期，規劃者將這一概念稱為15號公園。

column1: Central Park formally came into being in 1976.
column2: 中央公園於1976年正式成立。

column1: At one point, the park featured a library, basketball courts, tennis courts, a parking lot, the District swimming pool, and Sun Yat-sen Arena.
column2: 公園一度設有圖書館、籃球場、網球場、停車場、地區游泳池和中山體育場。

column1: The park was adopted by the Rotary Club and thus also became known as Rotary Park.
column2: 該公園由扶輪社認養，因此也稱為扶輪公園。

column1: In the 1990s, most of the built-up areas were removed and replaced with grassy or wooded parkland.
column2: 1990年代，大多數建築區遭到拆除，取而代之的是草木繁茂的公園。

column1: This was the result of the efforts of environmentalist groups, and dovetailed with the construction of the MRT Red Line.
column2: 這是環保團體努力的結果，並與捷運紅線的建設互相搭配。

column1: The Kaohsiung Rapid Transit Corporation footed the bill for the conversion.
column2: 轉換經費由高雄捷運公司支付。

column1: In February 2014, it came to light that city officials had privately come to an agreement with a charitable organization founded on behalf of a deceased lumber tycoon to pave over a wooded area at the northwest corner of Central Park and erect a public library bearing the name of said individual.
column2: 2014年2月，市政府官員私下與代表一名已故木材大亨成立的公益團體達成協議，在中央公園西北角的一個林區鋪設路面，並設立一個含有該人姓名的公共圖書館。

column1: A wide array of local citizens have arisen to oppose the proposed partial paving over of Central Park.
column2: 大批當地居民站出來，反對中央公園進行部分改建的提案。

column1: Central Park includes Kaohsiung Literature Library, Scenic Lake, Middle Island, Speech Square, Water Square, Hedgerow Labyrinth and Outdoor Terrace.
column2: 中央公園包括高雄文學館、景觀湖泊、中島、市民廣場、親水廣場、籬笆迷宮和戶外露臺。

column1: Water Square offers 20-minute-long "water dances" several times a day.
column2: 親水廣場每天有幾次長達20分鐘的「水舞」。

column1: The park is accessible from Central Park Station of Kaohsiung MRT.
column2: 可自高雄捷運中央公園站進入公園。

column1: The main exit of the station is located at the east edge of the park.
column2: 車站的主要出口位於公園的東邊。

column1: The spelling Taipei derives from the Wade–Giles romanization T'ai-pei which means the North of Taiwan in Chinese.
column2: 臺北的拼寫源自威妥瑪式羅馬拼音的T'ai-pei，中文的意思是臺灣北部。

column1: The name could be also romanized as Táiběi according to Hanyu Pinyin and Tongyong Pinyin.
column2: 以漢語拼音和通用拼音來拼，這個名字也可羅馬化為Táiběi。

column1: The Empire of Japan acquired Taiwan in 1895 under the Treaty of Shimonoseki after the First Sino-Japanese War.
column2: 第一次中日戰爭後，日本帝國於1895年根據《馬關條約》佔領臺灣。

column1: Taiwan became a colony of Imperial Japan with Taihoku (formerly Taipeh-fu) as its capital.
column2: 臺灣成為日本帝國的殖民地，以台北（前身為台北府）為首府。

column1: Prior to the significant influx of Han Chinese immigrants, the region of Taipei Basin was mainly inhabited by the Ketagalan plains aborigines.
column2: 在漢人移民大量湧入之前，臺北盆地地區主要由凱塔格蘭族平地原住民居住。

column1: The number of Han immigrants gradually increased in the early 18th century under Qing Dynasty rule after the government began permitting development in the area.
column2: 18世紀初，在清朝統治下，政府開始批准該地區發展，漢人移民人數逐漸增加。

column1: In 1875, the northern part of the island was incorporated into the new Taipeh Prefecture.
column2: 1875年，該島北部併入新成立的台北府。

column1: The Qing dynasty of China made Taipeh-fu the temporary capital of the island in 1887 when it was declared a province (Fukien-Taiwan Province).
column2: 1887年，中國的清朝將台北府定為該島的臨時首府，並省格為省（福建臺灣省）。

column1: Taipeh was formally made the provincial capital in 1894.
column2: 台北於1894年正式成為省會。

column1: Taipei was renamed to Taihoku in 1895 when the Empire of Japan annexed Taiwan.
column2: 1895年，當日本帝國佔領臺灣後，臺北更名為 Taihoku。

column1: Under Japanese rule, the city was administered under Taihoku Prefecture.
column2: 在日本統治下，該市由台北州管理。

column1: Taiwan's Japanese rulers embarked on an extensive program of advanced urban planning that featured extensive railroad links.
column2: 臺灣的日本統治者開始進行大規模現代化都市計劃規畫，該計劃以廣泛的鐵路連線為特色。

column1: A number of Taipei landmarks and cultural institutions date from this period.
column2: 臺北的某些地標和文化設施可以追溯到這一時期。

column1: Following the surrender of Japan to the United States of America of 1945, effective control of Taiwan was handed to the Republic of China (ROC).
column2: 1945年日本向美國投降後，對臺灣的有效控制權交給了中華民國（ROC）。

column1: After losing mainland China to the Chinese Communist Party in the Chinese Civil War, the ruling Kuomintang relocated the ROC government to Taiwan and declared Taipei the provisional capital of the ROC in December 1949. Taiwan's Kuomintang rulers regarded the city as the capital of Taiwan Province and their control as mandated by General Order No. 1.
column2: 在中國內戰中國民黨將中國大陸輸給中國共產黨後，執政的國民黨將中華民國政府遷至臺灣，並於1949年12月宣佈臺北為中華民國的臨時首都。臺灣的國民黨統治者將該市設為臺灣省省會，並根據一般命令第1號授權對其進行控制。

column1: In 1990 Taipei provided the backdrop for the Wild Lily student rallies that moved Taiwanese society from one-party rule to multi-party democracy by 1996.
column2: 1990年，臺北發生野百合學生運動，到1996年，該運動將臺灣社會從一黨獨大轉向多黨民主政治。

column1: The city has ever since served as the seat of Taiwan's democratically elected national government.
column2: 此後，該市一直是臺灣民選國家政府的所在地。

column1: The region known as the Taipei Basin was home to Ketagalan tribes before the eighteenth century.
column2: 這個稱為臺北盆地的地區，在十八世紀之前是凱達加蘭族部落的所在地。

column1: Han Chinese mainly from Southern Fujian Province of Qing dynasty China began to settle in the Taipei Basin in 1709.
column2: 1709年，清代中國主要來自福建省南部的漢人，開始在臺北盆地定居。

column1: In the late 19th century, the Taipei area, where the major Han Chinese settlements in northern Taiwan and one of the designated overseas trade ports, Tamsui, were located, gained economic importance due to the booming overseas trade, especially that of tea export.
column2: 19世紀末，由於海外貿易，特別是茶葉出口的繁榮，臺灣北部的主要漢人定居點兼指定通商口岸之一淡水所在的臺北地區，經濟上變得越來越重要。

column1: In 1875, the northern part of Taiwan was separated from Taiwan Prefecture and incorporated into the new Taipeh Prefecture as a new administrative entity of the Qing dynasty.
column2: 1875年，臺灣北部自臺灣府分出，清朝新設行政區台北府。

column1: Having been established adjoining the flourishing townships of Bangka, Dalongdong, and Twatutia, the new prefectural capital was known as Chengnei (Chinese: 城內; pinyin: chéngnèi; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: siâⁿ-lāi), "the inner city", and government buildings were erected there.
column2: 毗鄰蓬勃發展的艋舺、大龍崠和大稻埕，新設立的台北府稱為城內，興建政府辦公廳舍。

column1: From 1875 until the beginning of Japanese rule in 1895, Taipei was part of Tamsui County of Taipeh Prefecture and the prefectural capital.
column2: 從1875年到1895年日本統治開始，臺北是淡水廳和台北府的一部分。

column1: In 1885, work commenced to govern the island as a province, and Taipeh was temporarily made the provincial capital.
column2: 1885年開始於該島設省治理，台北暫時成為省會。

column1: The city officially became the capital in 1894. All that remains from the historical period is the north gate.
column2: 這座城市於1894年正式成為首府。當時遺留至今的僅有北門。

column1: The west gate and city walls were demolished by the Japanese while the south gate, little south gate, and east gate were extensively modified by the Kuomintang and have lost much of their original character.
column2: 西門和城牆由日本人拆除，而南門、小南門和東門遭國民黨大幅修改，失去了大部分原有特色。

column1: As settlement for losing the First Sino-Japanese War, China ceded the island of Taiwan to the Empire of Japan in 1895 as part of the Treaty of Shimonoseki.
column2: 由於第一次中日戰爭清朝敗北，在《馬關條約》中一部分，規定中國於1895年將臺灣島割讓給日本帝國。

column1: After the Japanese take-over, Taipei, called Taihoku in Japanese, was retained as the capital and emerged as the political center of the Japanese Colonial Government.
column2: 日本接管後，臺北在日語中被稱為 Taihoku，獲保留為首都，同時成為日本殖民政府的政治中心。

column1: During that time the city acquired the characteristics of an administrative center, including many new public buildings and housing for civil servants.
column2: 在此期間，該市真正成為行政中心，包括興建許多新的公共建築和公務員宿舍。

column1: Much of the architecture of Taipei dates from the period of Japanese rule, including the Presidential Office Building which was the Office of the Governor-General of Taiwan.
column2: 臺北的大部分建築可以追溯到日治時期，包括時為臺灣總督府的總統府。

column1: During Japanese rule, Taihoku was incorporated in 1920 as part of Taihoku Prefecture.
column2: 在日治期間，台北於1920年為台北州的一部分。

column1: It included Bangka, Twatutia, and Jōnai (城內) among other small settlements.
column2: 轄區包括艋舺、大稻埕和城內，以及其他小聚落。

column1: The eastern village of Matsuyama (松山庄, modern-day Songshan District, Taipei) was annexed into Taihoku City in 1938. Taihoku and surrounding areas were bombed by Allied forces on several occasions.
column2: 東部的松山莊（今臺北松山區）於1938年併入台北市。台北和周邊地區多次遭盟軍轟炸。

column1: The largest of these Allied air raids, the Taihoku Air Raid, took place on 31 May 1945.
column2: 盟軍空襲中規模最大的一次，即台北大空襲，發生在1945年5月31日。

column1: Upon the Japanese defeat in the Pacific War and its consequent surrender in August 1945, the Kuomintang (Chinese Nationalist Party) assumed control of Taiwan.
column2: 1945年8月，日本在太平洋戰爭中戰敗並隨之投降後，國民黨（中國國民黨）接管了臺灣。

column1: Subsequently, a temporary Office of the Taiwan Province Administrative Governor was established in Taipei City.
column2: 隨後，臺灣省行政長官臨時公署在臺北市成立。

column1: In 1947 the Kuomintang (KMT) government under Chiang Kai-shek declared island-wide martial law in Taiwan as a result of the 28 February Incident, which began with incidents in Taipei but led to an island-wide crackdown on the local population by forces loyal to Chiang.
column2: 1947年，由於228事件，蔣介石主政下的國民黨（KMT）宣佈臺灣全島戒嚴，該事件始於臺北，但導致效忠蔣介石的部隊對當地居民進行了全島鎮壓。

column1: Two years later, on 7 December 1949, Chiang and the Kuomintang forces were forced to flee mainland China by the Communists near the end of the Chinese Civil War.
column2: 兩年後，1949年12月7日，蔣和國民黨軍隊在中國內戰接近尾聲時，被共產黨人強迫驅離中國大陸。

column1: The KMT-led national government that fled to Taiwan declared Taipei to be the provisional capital of a continuing Republic of China, with the official capital at Nanjing (Nanking) even though that city was under Communist control.
column2: 逃往臺灣的國民黨國民政府，宣佈臺北為續存的中華民國的臨時首都，官方首都仍在南京，不過該市處於共產黨控制之下。

column1: Taipei expanded greatly in the decades after 1949, and as approved on 30 December 1966, by the Executive Yuan, Taipei was declared a special centrally administered municipality on 1 July 1967, and given the administrative status of a province.
column2: 1949年後的幾十年間，臺北轄區大幅擴張，經行政院於1966年12月30日核准，臺北於1967年7月1日升格為院轄市，相當於省級行政位階。

column1: In the following year, Taipei City expanded again by annexing Shilin, Beitou, Neihu, Nangang, Jingmei, and Muzha.
column2: 隔年，臺北市再次擴張，併入士林、北投、內湖、南港、景美和木柵。

column1: At that time, the city's total area increased fourfold by absorbing several outlying towns and villages and the population increased to 1.56 million people.
column2: 當時，該市的總面積增加了四倍，併入了幾個邊陲城鎮和村落，人口增加到156萬人。

column1: The city's population, which had reached one million in the early 1960s, also expanded rapidly after 1967, exceeding two million by the mid-1970s.
column2: 該市的人口在1960年代初達到100萬，1967年後也迅速增長，到1970年代中期超過200萬。

column1: Although growth within the city itself gradually slowed thereafter — its population had become relatively stable by the mid-1990s – Taipei remained one of the world's most densely populated urban areas, and the population continued to increase in the region surrounding the city, notably along the corridor between Taipei and Keelung.
column2: 儘管此後城市的內部增長逐漸趨緩—到1990年代中期，其人口變得相對穩定——但臺北仍然是世界上人口最稠密的都市地區之一，城市周邊地區的人口繼續增長，特別是在臺北和基隆之間的路廊沿線。

column1: In 1990 Taipei's 16 districts were consolidated into the current 12 districts.
column2: 1990年，臺北的16個區整併為目前的12個區。

column1: Mass democracy rallies that year in the plaza around Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall led to an island-wide transition to multi-party democracy, where legislators are chosen via regularly scheduled popular elections, during the presidency of Lee Teng-Hui.
column2: 那一年，在中正紀念堂廣場上舉行了大規模民主集會，導致了全島向多黨民主的過渡，在李登輝擔任總統期間，立法委員透過定期全民選舉選出。

column1: Taipei City is located in the Taipei Basin in northern Taiwan.
column2: 臺北市位於臺灣北部的臺北盆地。

column1: It is bordered by the Xindian River on the south and the Tamsui River on the west.
column2: 南側有新店溪，西部與淡水河圍繞。

column1: The generally low-lying terrain of the central areas on the western side of the municipality slopes upward to the south and east and especially to the north, where it reaches 1,120 metres (3,675 ft) at Qixing Mountain, the highest (inactive) volcano in Taiwan in Yangmingshan National Park.
column2: 該市西側到中央地區的一般低窪地形，向南和向東傾斜，特別是向北傾斜，陽明山國家公園有臺灣最高的（不活躍）火山七星山，高度達到1120米（3675英尺）。

column1: The northern districts of Shilin and Beitou extend north of the Keelung River and are bordered by Yangmingshan National Park.
column2: 北側的士林和北投地區延伸到基隆河以北，與陽明山國家公園接壤。

column1: The Taipei city limits cover an area of 271.7997 km² (104.9425 sq mi), ranking sixteenth of twenty-five among all counties and cities in Taiwan.
column2: 臺北市面積為271.7997平方公里（104.9425平方英里），在臺灣 25 縣市中排名第16位。

column1: Two peaks, Qixing Mountain and Mt.
column2: 有兩座山峰，七星山和

column1: Datun, rise to the northeast of the city.
column2: 大屯山，位於該市東北側。

column1: Qixing Mountain is located on the Tatun Volcano Group and the tallest mountain at the rim of the Taipei Basin, with its main peak at 1,120 metres (3,670 ft).
column2: 七星山位於大屯火山群，是臺北盆地邊緣最高的山峰，主峰為1120米（3670英尺）。

column1: Datun's main peak is 1,092 metres (3,583 ft).
column2: 大屯山主峰為1092米（3,583英尺）。

column1: These former volcanoes make up the western section of Yangmingshan National Park, extending from Mt.
column2: 這些過往的火山構成了陽明山國家公園的西部，從大屯山延伸至

column1: Caigongkeng (菜公坑山).
column2: 菜公坑山。

column1: Located on a broad saddle between two mountains, the area also contains the marshy Datun Pond.
column2: 該地區位於兩座山之間的寬大鞍部之間，還包含大屯沼澤池。

column1: To the southeast of the city lie the Songshan Hills and the Qingshui Ravine, which form a barrier of lush woods.
column2: 城市東南部是松山和清水峽谷，形成了鬱鬱蔥蔥的樹林屏障。

column1: When compared to other Asian cities, Taipei has "excellent" capabilities for managing air quality in the city.
column2: 與其他亞洲城市相比，臺北在城市空氣品質管理方面表現「優秀」。

column1: Its rainy climate, location near the coast, and strong environmental regulations have prevented air pollution from becoming a substantial health issue, at least compared to cities in southeast Asia and industrial China.
column2: 至少與東南亞和中國工業區的城市相比，其多雨氣候、靠近海岸的位置和強有力的環境法規，使空氣汙染不會重大健康問題。

column1: However, smog is extremely common and there is poor visibility throughout the city after rain-less days.
column2: 然而，霧霾非常普遍，在無雨天後，整個城市的能見度很低。

column1: Motor vehicle engine exhaust, particularly from motor scooters, is a source of air pollution in Taipei.
column2: 機動車引擎的廢氣，特別是機車的排氣，是臺北空氣汙染的主要來源。

column1: There are higher levels of fine particulate matter and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in the mornings because of less air movement; sunlight reduces some pollution.
column2: 由於空氣移動較少，早上的微粒和多環芳香烴含量較高；陽光會減少一些汙染。

column1: As Taiwan's business, financial, and technology hub, Taipei has been at the center of rapid economic development in the country and has now become one of the global cities in technology and electronics.
column2: 身為臺灣商業、金融和技術樞紐，臺北一直是該國經濟快速發展的中心，現在已成為全球技術和電子城市之一。

column1: This development is part of the so-called Taiwan Miracle which has seen dramatic growth in the city following foreign direct investment in the 1960s.
column2: 這種發展是所謂臺灣奇蹟的一部分，在1960年代外國直接投資進入後，該市大幅成長。

column1: Taiwan is now a creditor economy, holding one of the world's largest foreign exchange reserves of over US$403 billion as of December 2012.
column2: 臺灣現在是一個債權經濟體，截至2012年12月，擁有世界上最大級的外匯存底，超過4030億美元。

column1: Despite the Asian financial crisis, the economy continues to expand at about 5% per year, with virtually full employment and low inflation.
column2: 儘管發生亞洲金融風暴，因就業充分、通貨膨脹低，經濟繼續以每年約5%的速度增長。

column1: The city's GDP stand at US$327 billion in 2014.
column2: 2014年，該市的國內生產總值為3270億美元。

column1: As of 2013, the nominal GDP per capita in Taipei city is 5th highest in East Asia, behind Tokyo, Singapore, Osaka, and Hong Kong, but ahead of Seoul, as well as London and Paris, according to The Economist.
column2: 據《經濟學人》報導，截至2013年，臺北市人均名目國內生產總值在東亞排名第五，僅次於東京、新加坡、大阪和香港，高首爾、倫敦、巴黎。

column1: GDP per capita based on Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) in Taipei in 2015 was US$44173, behind that of Singapore (US$90151 in 2016 from the IMF) and Hong Kong (US$58322 in 2016 from the IMF; also based on PPP).
column2: 2015年，臺北基於購買力平價（PPP）的人均國內生產總值為44173美元，僅次於新加坡（2016年根據國際貨幣基金組織為90151美元）和香港（2016年根據國際貨幣基金組織為58322美元；也基於購買力平價）。

column1: The Financial Times ranked Taipei highly in economic potential (2nd, behind Tokyo) and business friendliness (4th) in 2015.
column2: 2015年，英國《金融時報》在經濟潛力（第2位，僅次於東京）和商業友好性（第4位）方面對臺北做出高度評價。

column1: The city is home to 30 billionaires, the 16th most in the world, ahead of many global cities such as Los Angeles and Sydney.
column2: 這座城市擁有30位億萬富翁，位居世界第16位，領先於洛杉磯和雪梨等許多全球城市。

column1: Business Insider also ranks Taipei the 5th most high-tech city globally, the highest in Asia, in 2017.
column2: 2017年，《商業內幕》還將臺北列為全球第五大高科技城市，亞洲最強。

column1: While the IESE Cities in Motion Index 2017 ranks Taipei as the smartest technology city globally.
column2: 而2017年IESE城市運轉指數，將臺北列為全球最智慧的科技城市。

column1: Taipei's main development fields include the information and communications technology (hardware and software), biotechnology, general merchandising (wholesale/retail), financial services, and MICE industries.
column2: 臺北的主要發展領域包括資訊和通訊技術（硬體和軟體）、生物技術、一般商品銷售（批發/零售）、金融服務和會展行業。

column1: Most of the country's major firms are based there including Asus, CTBC Bank, Fubon Financial Holding, Tatung Company, D-Link, and others.
column2: 該國大多數大公司都將總部設於台北，包括華碩、中國信託銀行、富邦金融控股、大同公司、D-Link等。

column1: 5 Global Fortune 500 companies are headquartered in Taipei.
column2: 5家全球財星500強公司，總部設於臺北。

column1: The city also attracts many multi-national corporations, international financial institutions, foreign consulates, and business organizations to set up base there.
column2: 該市還吸引了許多跨國公司、國際金融機構、外國領事館和商業組織在此設立基地。

column1: Thus, Taipei has nearly 3,500 registered foreign businesses and attracts over 50% of the total foreign investment in Taiwan.
column2: 因此，臺北有近3500家註冊外國企業，吸引了臺灣外國投資總額的50%以上。

column1: Foreign companies with offices or regional headquarters in Taipei include Google, Microsoft, IBM, Intel, HSBC, Citibank, Facebook, Amazon, Apple, JP Morgan, PwC, and many others.
column2: 在臺北設有辦事處或區域總部的外國公司包括Google、微軟、IBM、英特爾、匯豐銀行、花旗銀行、Facebook、Amazon、蘋果、摩根大通、資誠等許多公司。

column1: Most financial and foreign firms like to reside in the central business district of Taipei, the Xinyi Special District.
column2: 大多數金融和外國公司都喜歡駐點於臺北的中心商業區，即信義計畫區。

column1: With Citi, JP Morgan, DBS Bank, Cathay Life Insurance, Shin Kong Commercial Bank, Hua Nan Bank, and soon Fubon Financial and Nan Shan Life Insurance all establishing skyscrapers in the area.
column2: 花旗、摩根大通、星展銀行、國泰人壽保險、新光商業銀行、華南銀行在該地興建摩天大樓，富邦金融和南山人壽保險也將加入。

column1: Meanwhile, technology and electronics companies are often colocated in the Neihu Technology Park or the Nankang Software Park.
column2: 同時，科技、電子公司通常位於內湖科技園區或南港軟體園區。

column1: The startup and innovation scene in Taipei is also very vibrant.
column2: 臺北的創業和新創活動也非常活躍。

column1: In 2018 alone, Microsoft announced plans to invest US$34 million to create an artificial intelligence R&D center in Taipei, while Google announced it will hire 300 people and train 5,000 more in artificial intelligence for machines.
column2: 光是在2018年，微軟就宣佈計劃投資3400萬美元，在臺北建立一個人工智慧研發中心，而 Google宣佈將僱用300人，並培訓5000人，用以發展人工智慧。

column1: Taipei is currently Google's biggest engineering site in Asia.
column2: 台北目前是 Google 在亞洲地區最大的工程中心。

column1: IBM also announced in 2018 that it will develop a cloud research lab and expand its R&D center in Taipei with eyes on artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, and cloud computing.
column2: IBM還在2018年宣佈，將開發一個雲端研究實驗室，並擴大在臺北研發中心，重點是人工智慧、區塊鏈技術和雲端運算。

column1: According to the 2016 Global Entrepreneurship Development Index, Taipei's entrepreneurial spirit ranks 6th worldwide and 1st in Asia.
column2: 根據2016年全球創業發展指數，臺北的創業精神在全球排名第六，在亞洲排名第一。

column1: Taipei has more than 400 startups and numerous incubation centers, accelerators, venture capitals, and angel investors.
column2: 臺北擁有400多家新創企業和眾多育成中心、加速器、創業投資和天使投資人。

column1: The city's startup ecosystem is valued at US$580 million by Startup Genome in 2018.
column2: 2018年，據 Startup Genome 估計，該市的新創產業估值為5.8億美元。

column1: Tourism is a small but significant component of the local economy with international visitors totaling almost 3 million in 2008. Taipei has many top tourist attractions and contributes a significant amount to the US$6.8 billion tourism industry in Taiwan.
column2: 旅遊業是當地經濟中規模較小但重要的組成部分，2008年國際旅客總數接近300萬。 臺北擁有許多頂級旅遊景點，在臺灣總值68億美元的旅遊產業佔有重要地位。

column1: Tourism is a major part of Taipei's economy.
column2: 旅遊業是臺北經濟的主要組成部分。

column1: In 2013, over 6.3 million overseas visitors visited Taipei, making the city the 15th most visited globally.
column2: 2013年，超過630萬海外遊客來到臺北，該市成為全球第15大觀光城市。

column1: The influx of visitors contributed US$10.8 billion to the city's economy in 2013, the 9th highest in the world and the most of any city in the Chinese-speaking world.
column2: 2013年，遊客的湧入為該市經濟貢獻了108億美元，排名世界各城市第九高，也是華語世界中的首位。

column1: The National Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall is a famous monument, landmark and tourist attraction that was erected in memory of General Chiang Kai-shek, former President of the Republic of China.
column2: 中正紀念堂是一座著名的紀念館、地標和旅遊景點，是為了紀念中華民國前總統蔣介石而設立的。

column1: The structure stands at the east end of Memorial Hall Square, site of the National Concert Hall and National Theater and their adjacent parks as well as the memorial.
column2: 該建築位於紀念堂廣場的東端，廣場還包括國家音樂廳、國家劇院、相鄰的公園與紀念堂本體。

column1: The landmarks of Liberty Square stand within sight of Taiwan's Presidential Office Building in Taipei's Zhongzheng District.
column2: 自由廣場的地標，矗立在臺北中正區的臺灣總統府附近。

column1: Yang was born 10 November 1958 in the Wen Qiang village, Cibihu town of Dali, Yunnan province.
column2: 1958 年 11 月 10 日，楊出生在雲南省大理白族自治州茈碧湖鎮文強村。

column1: She the eldest of four children.
column2: 她在四個孩子中排行老大。

column1: Her parents and grandparents, members of the Bai ethnic minority, were farmers in a nearby village.
column2: 她的雙親和祖父母都是少數民㫍白族，在鄰村務農。

column1: Her grandmother was a singer in the village.
column2: 她的祖母是村中的歌手。

column1: Yang began her formal dance training at the late age of 11, at a dance troupe in the Xishuangbanna area of Yunnan, after her family moved to the area.
column2: 楊的正式舞蹈訓練開始得很晚，11 歲舉家搬到雲南西雙版納後，才加入當地的一個舞團。

column1: In the Southern flatlands of Yunnan, Xishuangbanna borders the country of Burma and is dominated by the Dai ethnic group, whose Peacock dance she would become synonymous with.
column2: 西雙版納位在雲南南方的平坦地區，鄰近緬甸，以傣族人口居多；其孔雀舞後來也變成她的招牌。

column1: In her early 20's, after she moved to Beijing to dance with the Central Nationalities Song and Dance Ensemble, she made the peacock dance her own, recasting parts of it with deft arm and finger movements.
column2: 她在二十歲出頭時到北京加入中央民族歌舞團，獨自發展出自己的孔雀舞，以其靈巧的手臂與手指動作重現其精華。

column1: In 1986, that choreography and dance won her first prize in a national competition.
column2: 1986 年她在一場全國賽上獲得編舞與舞蹈首獎。

column1: She rose to national level fame in 1986 when she won first prize in a national dance competition for her original solo "Spirt of the Peacock" (雀之灵).
column2: 1986 年，她在全國舞蹈大賽上，以自創的獨舞「雀之靈」獲得首獎，舉國聞名。

column1: Ever since, she has been dubbed the "Peacock Princess".
column2: 之後大家就稱她「孔雀公主」。

column1: She was the director, choreographer and star of "Dynamic Yunnan", a show that drew sellout crowds all over China.
column2: 她是中國賣座電影「雲南映象」的導演、編舞家兼演員。

column1: She toured Europe and the United States in 2005.
column2: 2005 年，她在歐洲和美國巡迴演出。

column1: Between 2004 and 2008, Yang Liping directed and choreographed a trilogy: "Dynamic Yunnan", "Echoes of Shangri-la" and "Tibetan Myth".
column2: 2004 到 2008 年間，楊麗萍擔任「雲南映象」、「雲南的聲響」、「藏謎」三部曲的執導與編舞工作。

column1: In 2004, "Dynamic Yunnan" won five major awards at the National Lotus Awards, including Gold Award for Dance Spectacular, Best Choreography and Best Female Performer.
column2: 2004 年，「雲南映象」奪得中國舞蹈荷花獎的五項金質獎，包括最佳舞台效果、最佳編舞與最佳女性舞者。

column1: To create the exotic song and dance spectacular "Dynamic Yunnan", Yang spent years traveling to remote villages of the 26 ethnic minority tribes in Yunnan and selected over 60 peasants who had the natural gift of song and dance, from whom she built an archive re-creating this rich feast of sight and sound.
column2: 為了創作出「雲南映象」中異族風的歌曲與舞蹈，楊花了多年走遍雲南 26 個少數民族的偏鄉，集合超過 60 名具有歌舞天份的村人，採集並重新呈現出豐富的視聽饗宴。

column1: In May 2009, she revealed a dance and music production 'Yunnan Sound', at the Yunnan Art Institute's Experimental Theater.
column2: 2009 年 5 月，她於雲南藝術學院的實驗劇院中推出音樂舞蹈作品「雲南的響聲」。

column1: On November 17, 2009, US President Barack Obama is visit to China, she performed the classic dance "The Spirit of the Birds" at the Great Hall of the People.
column2: 2009 年 11 月 17 日，美國總統歐巴馬訪問中國，她在人民大會堂表演經典舞蹈「雀之靈」。

column1: She is currently a judge on So You Think You Can Dance China.
column2: 她目前在「中國好舞蹈」節目擔任評審。

column1: Yang's first husband was a colleague of the Central National Song and Dance Troupe and later divorced.
column2: 楊的第一任丈夫是她在中央民族歌舞團的同事，但後來離婚。

column1: The current husband, Liu Yuqing, is a Taiwanese-American.
column2: 現任丈夫劉淳晴是台裔美國人。

column1: They couple met in 1990 and married in 1995, but Yang wants to dance long-term dieting and cannot be pregnant.
column2: 兩人於 1990 年相識，1995 年結婚，但楊因為長期舞蹈而不孕。

column1: After getting her bachelor's degree in Architecture at the National Central University in Chongqing, China, Wang Chiu-Hwa moved to Seattle to continue her studies at the University of Washington in 1946.
column2: 在重慶的國立中央大學取得建築學士學位後，王秋華於 1946 年遷至西雅圖，在華盛頓大學繼續學業。

column1: She then studied a Masters of Architecture at Columbia University in New York.
column2: 之後他在紐約哥倫比亞大學攻讀建築碩士學位。

column1: From 1953 to 1979, Wang Chiu-Hwa worked with American architect Percival Goodman in New York.
column2: 1953 年到 1979 年間，王秋華在紐約和美國建築師 Percival Goodman  共事。

column1: She began working for him part-time as designer while still his student, and then worked for him full-time for almost thirty years, starting as an associate in 1960 and then becoming a partner.
column2: 她在向 Goodman 學習時，也以半工半讀方式參與設計工作，之後和他全職工作長達近三十年；1960 年開始時是其設計師，之後成為合夥人。

column1: Goodman exerted great influence on her architectural ideas; like Goodman, she strongly believes in the notion of the architect as having a social responsibility through their work.
column2: Goodman 對其建築設計理念影響甚大；如同 Goodman，她堅定認為建築師的工作必須具有社會責任感。

column1: Wang Chiu-Hwa returned to Taiwan in 1979.
column2: 1979 年王秋華返回台灣定居。

column1: She began teaching at the Taipei Institute of Technology and Tamkang University, and served as architectural consultant to a number of public institutions.
column2: 她開始在台北工專與淡江大學任教，同時擔任許多公共機構的建築顧問。

column1: In 1983, after collaborating with architect Joshua J. Pan on the Chung Yuan Christian University library, she started her own practice and has since been working in joint venture with J. J. Pan and Partners, Architects and Planners, on a number of projects.
column2: 1983 年她與建築師潘冀共同完成中原大學圖書館的設計後，便自行成立建築師事務所，並與潘冀聯合建築師事務所共同完成多項專案設計。

column1: Wang Chiu-Hwa's architectural designs are modernistic, with emphasis on environmental totality and scale.
column2: 王秋華的建築設計是現代風格，強調環境整體性與比例。

column1: In 1983–85, she designed the main library of Chung Yuan Christian University, which exemplifies her sense of spatial planning.
column2: 在 1983 到 85 年間，她設計了中原大學總圖書館，展現她對空間規畫的理念。

column1: It has a holding capacity of 700,000 volumes, a conference room with room for 150 people, and a study room with room for 800 people.
column2: 該圖書館藏書可達 700,000 冊，附有可容納 150 人的會議廳，以及可容納 800 人的閱覽室。

column1: Its multiple-entry plazas and sunken gardens were designed to encourage socialising.
column2: 其多進式的廣場，與下沉式的花園，是為了促進交流而設計。

column1: A special feature of the library is the attention given to energy conservation.
column2: 該圖書館的設計特色，是要強化活躍的對話。

column1: Natural lighting and ventilation were made possible through the use of double-height spaces, also providing visual fluidity and transparency.
column2: 使用兩倍高度的空間設計，以便擁有自然採光與通風，同時具備視覺流動性與透明感。

column1: This was her first major project after returning to Taiwan, and it won her the Taiwan Provincial Building Design Award and the National Building Design Award for Passive Energy Efficiency.
column2: 這是她回到台灣後的第一件主要作品，同時奪下台灣省政府優良建築設計獎，以及內政部建築節約能源優良設計獎。

column1: Over the next three decades, she designed a number of large and award-winning buildings in Taiwan, including but not limited to:
column2: 接下來的三十年間，她在台灣設計出許多得獎的大型建築物，包括但不限於：

column1: 1986: Precision Instruments Development Center for the National Science Council
column2: 1986：國科會精密儀器發展中心

column1: 1988: Medical Research Building & Conference Center for Veterans’ Hospital in Taichung
column2: 1988：台中榮總研究大樓與會議中心

column1: 1989: Gymnasium at Chung Yuan Christian University
column2: 1989：中原大學體育館

column1: 1989: Main Library of National Chang Hwa Normal University
column2: 1989：國立彰化師範大學總圖書館

column1: 1991–97: Doctors’ Dormitory of Taichung Veterans General Hospital
column2: 1991－97：台中榮總醫護單身宿舍

column1: 1993: Main Library and Information Sciences Center at the National Chung Cheng University
column2: 1993：國立中正大學圖書館暨資訊中心

column1: 1998: Founder's Memorial Library at the Chinese Culture University in Taipei
column2: 1998：台忠中國文化大學創辦人紀念圖書館

column1: 1997–2004: Holistic Education Village at Chung Yung Christian University
column2: 1997－2004：中原大學全人教育村

column1: 2000–2005: Gymnasium at Chinese Culture University
column2: 2000－2005：中國文化大學體育館

column1: Recognized for her many achievements, she was named Outstanding Architect of Taiwan ROC in 2003.
column2: 2003 年，由於許多卓越成就，她獲提名為國家傑出建築師。

column1: Chunghwa Telecom is the largest telecommunication service provider in Taiwan and one of the largest in Asia in terms of revenue.
column2: 中華電信是台灣最大的電訊服務商，以營業額來說，也在亞洲最大電公司之列。

column1: In terms of both revenue and customers, Chunghwa is Taiwan's largest provider of fixed line services, mobile services, broadband access service, and Internet service.
column2: 不論營業額或客戶數，中華電信都是台灣最大的固網、行動服務、寬頻接取與網路服務業者。

column1: The company also provides information and communication technology services to corporate customers.
column2: 該公司同時提供企業客戶資訊通訊技術服務。

column1: HiNet has been heavily criticised for being a haven for senders of email spam, which has resulted in many Internet service providers routinely blocking e-mails originating from the service.
column2: HiNet 因為發送垃圾郵件而遭到嚴厲指控，造成多家網路服務商經常阻擋來自其服務的電子郵件。

column1: Senao International, a cellular phone distributor from which Senao Networks, manufacturer of data networking products and wireless telephones under the EnGenius and Senao brands was spun off.
column2: 神腦國際是一家手機經銷商，旗下的資料網路產品與無線電話製造商神腦國際無線通訊事業群，後來分出成立神準科技，也使用神腦品牌。

column1: Chen Long-bin was born in 1964 in Taipei, Taiwan.
column2: 陳龍斌於 1964 年出生於台灣台北。

column1: He received a BFA from the Fine Arts Department at Tunghai University, and an MFA from the School of Visual Arts in New York.
column2: 他畢業於東海大學美術系，取得美國紐約視覺藝術學院碩士學位。

column1: He is known for using the cultural debris of our modern society, such as old, discarded books, newspapers, phonebooks, and magazines as the medium for his sculptures.
column2: 他最聞名的是以各種當代社會的文化垃圾，如被丟棄的舊書、舊報紙、電話簿、雜誌做為雕塑作品媒材。

column1: Chen is self-taught in carving wood, but started showing interest in our paper culture as a viable material for art – phonebooks, magazines, and computer paper when PC’s began growing popular in 1993.
column2: 陳的木雕為無師自通，後來開始對利用紙文化做為創作素材感到興趣，包括電話簿、雜誌，1993 年因電腦開始普及，也用印表紙來創作。

column1: The advent of the personal computer changed the entire nature of information documentation – a role books used to play.
column2: 個人電腦的發展，整個改變了資訊文件化的本質，原本由書扮演的角色遭到取代。

column1: Thus, by turning paper into the original wood for his sculptures, Chen offers renewed value to the meaning of paper.
column2: 因此，陳透過將紙轉變成其木雕作品的材料，賦予紙全新的價值。

column1: He uses chainsaws, drills, band saws, sanders, and scissors, along with other carpenter's tools to shape his remarkable busts and figures, which appear stone, or even marble like from a distance.
column2: 他使用鏈鋸、電鑽、砂紙、剪刀、以及各種木工工具，雕塑出他特別的胸像與人像，外觀看起來像石雕，遠看甚至像大理石。
